H0.text: The rotation of Earth is the process that most likely forms sand, a type of soil composed of very tiny pieces of material.

H1.text: The growth of animals is the process most likely to form sand, a type of soil made of very tiny pieces of material.

H2.text: The decay of large trees is the process most likely that forms sand, which is a type of soil made of very tiny pieces of material.

H3.text: The weathering of rocks is the process that most likely forms sand, which is a type of soil made of very tiny pieces of material.

A4.text: The materials left after the rock breaks down combine with organic material to create soil.

A5.text: Weathering is a crucial part of the rock cycle; sedimentary rock, the product of weathered rock, covers 66% of the Earth's continents and much of the ocean floor.
